intro: Trichomanes perpusillum, commonly known as the tiny maidenhair fern, is a small, delicate fern native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, lace-like fronds. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found growing on rocks or tree trunks. Its reproductive structures, called sori, are clustered on the underside of the fronds. Due to its small size and specific habitat requirements, it is often considered a rare and specialized species.
